org.hbase.async
Class Config

java.lang.Object
  org.hbase.async.Config

public class Config
extends Object

A configuration class that stores key/value pairs as strings similar to the System properties object. The class includes helper methods to parse the strings into numbers or booleans and it allows for loading a standard Java properties file from disk. The loadSystemAndDefaults will be called to set defaults and optionally load values from the System properties list.

Note that multiple threads can read from this config object but modifying values is not thread safe.

Since:
1.7.0

Field Detail

RUNNING_WINDOWS

public static final boolean RUNNING_WINDOWS
Flag to determine if we're running under Windows or not

properties

protected final HashMap<String,String> properties
The list of properties configured to their defaults or modified by users. We use a non-synchronized hash map for fast access as opposed to the HashTable backed properties objects.

default_map

protected final HashMap<String,String> default_map
Holds default values for the config

config_location

protected String config_location
Tracks the location of the file that was actually loaded

Constructor Detail

Config

public Config()
Constructor that initializes default configuration values from the System.properties map.

Config

public Config(String file)
       throws IOException
Constructor that initializes default values and attempts to load the given properties file

Parameters:
file - Path to the file to load
Throws:
IOException - Thrown if unable to read or parse the file

Config

public Config(Config parent)
Constructor for subclasses who want a copy of the parent config but without the ability to modify the original values. This constructor will not re-read the file, but it will copy the location so if a child wants to reload the properties periodically, they may do so

Parameters:
parent - Parent configuration object to load from
Method Detail

overrideConfig

public void overrideConfig(String property,
                           String value)
Allows for modifying properties after loading WARNING: This should only be used on initialization of the config object and it is not thread safe.

Parameters:
property - The name of the property to override
value - The value to store

getBoolean

public final boolean getBoolean(String property)
Returns the given property as a boolean Property values are case insensitive and the following values will result in a True return value: - 1 - True - Yes Any other values, including an empty string, will result in a False

Parameters:
property - The property to fetch
Returns:
A parsed boolean
Throws:
NullPointerException - if the property was not found

getDirectoryName

public final String getDirectoryName(String property)
Returns the directory name, making sure the end is an OS dependent slash

Parameters:
property - The property to fetch
Returns:
The property value with a forward or back slash appended
Throws:
NullPointerException - if the property was not found

hasProperty

public final boolean hasProperty(String property)
Determines if the given property is in the map

Parameters:
property - The property to search for
Returns:
True if the property exists and has a value, not an empty string

dumpConfiguration

public final String dumpConfiguration()
Returns a simple string with the configured properties for debugging. Note that any property with the string "PASS" will be obfuscated to hide passwords.

Returns:
A string with information about the config

getMap

public final Map<String,String> getMap()
Returns:
An copy of the configuration map

loadConfig

protected void loadConfig(String file)
                   throws FileNotFoundException,
                          IOException
Attempts to load the configuration from the given location

Parameters:
file - Path to the file to load
Throws:
IOException - Thrown if there was an issue reading the file
FileNotFoundException - Thrown if the config file was not found
